channel.title: Out of memory or address space. [windows 10, steam]
channel.description:
I'm using a windows 10 PC, I have a 4k Benq 60fps monitor, a GTX 1080 with 8gb of video RAM, a Ryzen 9 3900X, 64GB of 3000mhz Corsair Vengeance RAM and a 2TB samsung SSD to store it all.
I have no idea how 64gb of RAM and a GTX 1080 is not enough. I have tried several tricks already, like reinstalling the game, adding "-window -noborder", disabling steam overlay, and yet every time I boot it crashes after a few seconds of loading screen.
I bought the game several years ago and this is the first time I've had this problem (I hadn't launched since last year, but I was excited to play the new Xen levels until this happened)

item.title: Out of memory or address space. [windows 10, steam]
item.dc:creator: Fyfe_McAbel
item.description:
I’m using a windows 10 PC, I have a 4k Benq 60fps monitor, a GTX 1080 with 8gb of video RAM, a Ryzen 9 3900X, 64GB of 3000mhz Corsair Vengeance RAM and a 2TB samsung SSD to store it all.

I have no idea how 64gb of RAM and a GTX 1080 is not enough. I have tried several tricks already, like reinstalling the game, adding “-window -noborder”, disabling steam overlay, and yet every time I boot it crashes after a few seconds of loading screen.

I bought the game several years ago and this is the first time I’ve had this problem (I hadn’t launched since last year, but I was excited to play the new Xen levels until this happened)
